intro: Sisyrinchium hypsophilum, commonly known as the blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. It blooms in late spring to early summer, producing small, clustered inflorescences. Sisyrinchium hypsophilum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
